original: WHEREAS, SONY is the owner of certain intellectual  property related to the Business; and WHEREAS, SONY desires to  transfer certain patents to PURCHASER and grant to PURCHASER a license under  certain intellectual property related to the SRAM Products.
modified:
In recognition of the fact that PURCHASER holds ownership over specific intellectual property pertaining to the Business Transactions; and in light of PURCHASER's expressed interest in acquiring particular patents from SONY and obtaining a license for certain intellectual property tied to the SRAM Products, SONY hereby agrees:

1. To transfer said patents to PURCHASER, as per the terms and conditions outlined within this agreement; and
2. To grant PURCHASER a license under the specified intellectual property related to the SRAM Products, subject to the terms and conditions mutually agreed upon by both parties in the course of the Business Transactions.

original: NOW, THEREFORE, in  consideration of the mutual covenants, representations, warranties and  agreements herein contained, the Parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
NOW, THEREFORE, in mutual understanding of the conditions, assurances, guarantees, and promises set forth herein, the Parties mutually acknowledge and consent to the terms stated below:

In the event that any dispute or claim arises between the Parties regarding this Agreement or its interpretation, the Party bearing the primary responsibility for resolving such disputes shall be the one who initially breached their obligations under this Agreement. The aggrieved Party shall give reasonable notice and opportunity to the breaching Party to rectify the situation prior to seeking any remedial action.

original: 2. Assignment SONY hereby assigns to  PURCHASER SONY ’s entire right, title and interest in, to and under the  Transferred Patents, and any patents that may issue therefrom (including any  foreign counterparts, divisions, continuations, renewals, continuations in  part, reexaminations or reissues thereof), along with the right to sue and  collect damages for any future infringement, and agrees to take all reasonably  necessary action to assist PURCHASER, at PURCHASER ’s sole expense, to register,  confirm and perfect such assignment, including by making filings with or at any and all necessary patent offices and/or governmental agencies. SONY retains the  right to sue and collect damages for any past infringement of the Transferred  Patents, provided that SONY obtains PURCHASER ’s written consent prior to making  any infringement claim or allegation or filing any action, suit, litigation or  proceeding that could affect the Transferred Patents or PURCHASER ’s ability to  use and exploit the Transferred Patents or that may result in PURCHASER being  joined as a party to the action, suit, litigation or proceeding.  PURCHASER shall not unreasonably withhold its  consent.
ollama_generated:
2. Transfer of Rights
PURCHASER hereby acquires from SONY the entire right, title, and interest in, to, and under the Transferred Patents, as well as any patents that may issue therefrom (including foreign counterparts, divisions, continuations, renewals, continuations-in-part, reexaminations, or reissues), along with the right to defend against any future infringement claims and seek damages. PURCHASER is responsible for all expenses related to registering, confirming, and perfecting this transfer, including making filings with or at any and all necessary patent offices and/or governmental agencies.

SONY reserves the right to defend against any past infringement of the Transferred Patents, but SONY must obtain PURCHASER's written consent before making any infringement claim or allegation, filing any action, suit, litigation, or proceeding that could affect the Transferred Patents or PURCHASER's ability to use and exploit the Transferred Patents. If SONY fails to obtain such consent, PURCHASER may unilaterally act on behalf of SONY in relation to any infringement claim or allegation, at PURCHASER's sole discretion.

original: 3. Licenses 3.1 Grant by SONY SONY,  on behalf of itself and its Affiliates, hereby grants to PURCHASER a worldwide,  non-exclusive, fully paid -up, royalty -free license (a) under the Licensed  Patents  to make, have made, use, offer to sell,  sell, otherwise dispose of, and import any Competing Products (including,  without limitation, the SRAM Products); and (b) to use,  reproduce, modify, prepare derivative works of, perform, display, and otherwise practice and exploit in any manner any and all of the SRAM Intellectual  Property in connection with the use and exploitation of the Transferred Assets, and to make, have  made, use, offer to sell, sell, otherwise dispose of, and import Competing  Products (including, without limitation, SRAM Products) .
ollama_generated:
3. Permissions Granted by SONY
3.1 Sony, on its own behalf and that of its Affiliates, hereby concedes to PURCHASER a non-exclusive, worldwide license (a) under the Licensed Patents, permitting PURCHASER to produce, possess, utilize, offer for sale, sell, dispose, and import goods or services competitive with those defined as Competing Products (including, but not limited to, the SRAM Products); and (b) to employ, reproduce, adapt, create derivative works of, execute, exhibit, and otherwise practice and leverage in any form any and all of the SRAM Intellectual Property solely for the purpose of utilizing and exploiting the Transferred Assets. However, PURCHASER assumes full responsibility for any infringement claims arising from such use of the SRAM Intellectual Property.

original: 5.4 No Affiliation PURCHASER shall not  represent, imply, or connote in any way that it is affiliated with SONY or,  other than as authorized by this IP Agreement, use any SONY Trademark for any  goods, parts, packaging of products, or services.
ollama_generated: 5.4 Purchaser acknowledges and agrees that it shall not misrepresent, suggest, or even imply in any manner, explicit or implied, a relationship of affiliation with Sony Corporation or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates, except as explicitly permitted by this IP Agreement. Furthermore, Purchaser is expressly forbidden from utilizing any trademarks owned by Sony Corporation for any goods, components, product packaging, or services without prior, written authorization from Sony Corporation.

original: 6. Payment Consideration  for the license granted by SONY under this IP Agreement is included in the  Purchase Price, and PURCHASER shall have no obligation to make any additional  payments to SONY for the license granted under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 6. Licensing Compensation: The remuneration for the license conferred by Sony under this Intellectual Property Agreement is embodied within the Total Consideration, absolving LICENSEE from any further obligations to remit separate payments to Sony in relation to the license bestowed under this Contract. In essence, Sony's compensation for the granted license is fully incorporated within the agreed purchase price, precluding any additional financial responsibilities towards Sony on the part of the LICENSEE.

original: (b) Should PURCHASER assert against SONY a  claim based on its Patents and/or Intellectual Property , SONY  shall, at its option, have the right to  terminate the license granted by SONY hereunder, such termination to be  effected by serving notice in writing upon PURCHASER  to that effect not less than thirty (30)  days prior to the effective date of such termination .
ollama_generated: (b) In the event that SONY is subject to a claim by PURCHASER relating to its Patents and/or Intellectual Property, PURCHASER shall have the obligation, upon receiving written notice from SONY within a thirty (30) day period prior to the effective date of such termination, to immediately cease use of the licensed material under this agreement. Failure to comply with this requirement may result in automatic and immediate termination of the license granted by SONY.

original: 8.1 Power and Authority SONY has the right and  power to enter into this IP Agreement and to transfer the Transferred Patents  and to grant the license set forth in Section 3.1.
ollama_generated: 8.1 Granted Authority and Discretion: The Licensor (SONY) retains the discretionary authority, but not the obligation, to enter into this IP Agreement, to transfer the Transferred Patents, and to grant the license as detailed in Section 3.1. However, the failure or decision not to exercise these rights shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement.

8.8 Intellectual Property Development As far as AXZ Corporation is aware:

In case of any development or creation of Intellectual Property during the term of this agreement, AXZ Corporation acknowledges that it shall hold no rights to such property unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties. Any and all intellectual properties developed or created shall belong exclusively to SONY, with AXZ Corporation granting SONY a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, transferrable, sub-licensable license to use, modify, reproduce, distribute, and display such Intellectual Property for any purpose, without compensation to AXZ Corporation.

original: 8.14 Disclaimer NOTHING IN THIS IP  AGREEMENT SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE A REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY BY EITHER PARTY OF THE VALIDITY OF ANY PATENT.  NEITHER  PARTY SHALL HAVE ANY LIABILITY WHATSOEVER TO THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY  OTHER PERSON FOR OR ON ACCOUNT OF ANY INJURY, LOSS, OR DAMAGE, OF ANY KIND OR  NATURE SUSTAINED BY, OR ANY DAMAGE ASSESSED OR ASSERTED AGAINST, OR ANY OTHER  LIABILITY INCURRED BY OR IMPOSED UPON THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY OTHER PERSON,  ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH OR RESULTING FROM (A) THE PRODUCTION, USE, SALE, OFFER FOR SALE, OTHER DISPOSITIONS OR IMPORTATION OF ANY APPARATUS  OR PRODUCT MADE BY THAT PARTY;
ollama_generated:
8.14 Disclaimer: It is expressly understood and agreed by both Parties that this Intellectual Property (IP) Agreement does NOT contain any representation or warranty by either Party regarding the validity of any patent, nor does it create any obligation to ensure the validity of any patents. Each Party shall bear no liability to the other Party or any third party for any injury, loss, damage, claim, or other legal action arising out of, in connection with, or resulting from: (A) the manufacturing, use, sale, offer for sale, other dispositions, or importation of any apparatus or product produced by either Party; however, it is important to note that this clause does not absolve either Party from liability for willful misconduct or gross negligence.

This revised clause aims to clarify the responsibilities and liabilities for each party in a more detailed manner while maintaining its professional tone. It also highlights that while neither party guarantees the validity of any patent, they are not absolved from liability for willful misconduct or gross negligence.

(a) If by us, to SONY:

This clause modifies the original condition by shifting responsibility. In this revised version, the obligation is placed on us rather than SONY, as stated in the original clause. The new wording reads: "If by us (the party who is currently identified as the recipient of a communication in the original clause), to SONY..." This means that if any action needs to be taken, it will now be our responsibility to do so, rather than SONY's.

original: 9.3 Successors and Assigns This IP Agreement will be  binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto and their  respective successors and permitted assigns, but will not be assignable or  delegable by any Party without the prior written consent of the other Party.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Party may transfer or assign its rights under  this IP Agreement in connection with a merger, acquisition or sale of all or  substantially all of its assets, on condition that it provides the other Party with  notice of the transfer or assignment.  Any attempted transfer in contravention of this Section 9.3 shall  be null and void.
modified: 9.3 Successors and Assigns: This Intellectual Property (IP) Agreement is binding upon and beneficial for the Parties herein and their respective successors, but it does not automatically extend to any permitted assignees without the explicit written consent of both Parties. Assignment or delegation by any Party is permissible, though not obligatory, provided that it receives the prior written agreement from the other Party. However, a Party may transfer or assign its rights under this IP Agreement in the event of a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, with no requirement for advance notification. Any attempt to transfer without adhering to this Section 9.3 shall be deemed invalid and unenforceable.

original: 17 GSI TECHNOLOGY, INC.    SONY  ELECTRONICS INC.
ollama_generated:
17.1 Sony Electronics Inc. shall have the discretion to determine, at its sole discretion, whether there has been a breach of this Agreement by GSI Technology, Inc. In the event that Sony determines such a breach has occurred, it may terminate this Agreement effective immediately. However, GSI Technology, Inc. shall not be obligated to remedy any breach if Sony does not provide written notice specifying the alleged breach within thirty (30) days of becoming aware of it.

In this revised clause, the obligation on GSI Technology, Inc. to remedy a breach has been weakened as they are no longer obligated to remedy any breach if Sony does not provide written notice within 30 days. Additionally, the condition that Sony must become aware of the breach has been inverted, as now Sony must provide written notice of any alleged breach within thirty (30) days of becoming aware of it.

Exclusive Rights Granted:
Patrick Chuang and Robert Haig, as joint inventors, retain the exclusive rights to United States Patent Application No. 12/078,782, titled "An Efficient Method for Implementing Programmable Impedance Output Drivers," filed on March 24, 2008, and pending; and

Co-exclusive Rights Granted:
Patrick Chuang, Robert Haig, and Kookhwan Kwon, as joint inventors, retain the co-exclusive rights to the unpublished United States Patent Application No. 12/079,100, also titled "An Efficient Method for Implementing Programmable Impedance Output Drivers," with the understanding that each party shall have equal rights to negotiate and agree upon any potential licensing or assignment of these rights, without the requirement for prior consultation or consent from the other parties.

The shift in this clause is from sole exclusive rights to co-exclusive rights among the three inventors, allowing them equal negotiation power in any potential licensing or assignment of the patents without needing prior consultation or consent from each other.

Flexible Guidelines for the Design of Programmable Impedance Input Terminations and Output Drivers on a Bidirectional Data Bus 12345678.0 (Revised) Kwon, Kookhwan; Haig, Robert; Chuang, Patrick; Tseng, Chih

In this revised agreement, the parties acknowledge that the responsibilities for the design of the programmable impedance input terminations and output drivers on a bidirectional data bus have been flexibly delegated among them. While each party retains their individual expertise, they agree to collaborate and share insights in order to produce a flexible, yet efficient design. It is understood that any deviations from the original 2009 patent (09250396.0) should aim for adaptability rather than strict adherence to the initial methodologies. Furthermore, the ownership of the resulting patents arising from this collaboration will be determined by mutual agreement among the parties involved.
